title: How To Get A Free Kill Bill Fortnite Skin
description: After giving everyone a free Juice WRLD skin a year ago, Fortnite is once again offering a free licensed skin to mark the start of a new chapter. Anyone who logs into Fortnite between November 27 at 6 AM PT and December 1 at 6 AM PT will receive a skin based on Yuki Yubari, a character from Quentin Tarantino's Kill Bill who didn't make the final cut of the movie when it was originally released. This Yuki Yubari skin is free to anyone who logs into Fortnite between November 27 and December 1.Back when Tarantino wrote his massive two-part epic Kill Bill, it included an additional sequence that was cut before filming, in which Yuki seeks revenge for the death of her sister Gogo, whom The Bride had killed during the battle at the House of Blue Leaves. Yuki finally sees the light of day in Fortnite Chapter 7, apparently. The Yuki Yubari skin is not actually in the Fortnite game files yet, so you won't be granted the skin until after Chapter 7 begins on November 29. Yuki is one of at least three Kill Bill-related skins coming to Fortnite in Chapter 7. The Bride herself will be included in the Chapter 7 Season 1 battle pass, and a skin based on Gogo Yubari will be sold in the item shop--and you can also earn it by purchasing a ticket in advance for a showing of Kill Bill: The Whole Bloody Affair during its opening weekend. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Black Ops 7 Conspiracies Tackled By Call Of Duty SBMM Creator
description: This may be the winter of discontent for some Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 players. Activision has been notably quiet about the game's sales, and has yet to share metrics or statistics. There's also been an uptick in anger from fans over conspiracy issues related to the game's Skill-Based Matchmaking mode. That's led Charlie Olson--the creator of CoD's SBMM--to directly address some of those concerns himself. OIson--who spent a decade at Raven Software under Activision--shared a lengthy video on his YouTube channel that dives into how his SBMM is supposed to work. He also took the time to explain why Activision's announcement about bringing "open matchmaking" to Black Ops 7 didn't mean the game was dropping SBMM. If fans were expecting the chance to cut down inexperienced or casual players, they've been disappointed. Olson argues that it means the game has been dominated by "sweats," or experienced players, rather than rookie players. "Some players are leaving because they thought this tweet meant SBMM had been completely removed from the game, and then they felt betrayed by the inclusion of one standard matchmaking playlist, and then blamed it for stealing 'fodder' from the open playlist," explained Olson. "What's really going on here is there aren't enough casual players at launch to make open matchmaking the pubstomp that was expected or promise. If open lobbies are sweaty, it's because it's mostly sweats playing." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Official Lego Board Games Get Black Friday Lightning Deals at Amazon
description: Brick Like This! A Lego Party Game $13.49 (was $20) | Black Friday Lightning Deal See at Amazon Monkey Palace: A Lego Board Game $32 (was $42) | Black Friday Lightning Deal See at Amazon Amazon's Black Friday sale is filled with great deals on board and card games, but if you love Lego, there are two deals you'll want to check before they expire: Brick Like This and Monkey Palace. Brick Like This is an officially licensed Lego party game that launched in August for $20 and is on sale for only $13.49. Monkey Palace, meanwhile, turns building Lego structures into a dynamic and replayable strategy board game. Normally $42, Monkey Palace is on sale for $32 for a limited time. Brick Like This and Monkey Palace were designed by Dotted Games, one of the many studios under the Asmodee umbrella, and was formed specifically to collaborate with Lego on board/card games. Amazon's discounts are Lightning Deals with limited quantities. At the time of writing, Brick Like This is over 40% claimed, while Monkey Palace is over 20% claimed. Check out both official Lego board games below. We also included deals on the new Lego Recreate Activity Cards, which are up for grabs for only $8 each during Amazon's sale. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Best Buy Black Friday Sale - Save Big On Switch Games
description: Whether you recently picked up the new Nintendo Switch 2 or are looking for something to play on the original Switch, you'll want to check out Best Buy's Black Friday sale, as numerous games for both systems are on sale during the event. The deals include price cuts on physical Switch and Switch 2 games, as well as discounts on digital edition Switch games. The Switch 2 deals are focused on third-party releases like Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion for $50 (was $70) or EA Sports FC 26 for $30 (was $70), while the list of discounted Switch titles covers a mix of first- and third-party games, including up to 50% off on select Nintendo-published games like Super Mario Odyssey and Splatoon 3, both of which are $30 (normally $60). Considering Nintendo first-party releases rarely go on sale--and when they do, it's not by much--this is a great chance to stock up on Switch games for the holidays. And since Switch games are backwards compatible with the Switch 2--and in some cases have Switch 2 upgrades available--they could make great gifts for players of either console. Best Buy Black Friday Switch & Switch 2 Deals at a Glance See Switch 2 game deals at Best Buy See Switch physical game deals at Best Buy See Switch digital download deals at Best Buy See Nintendo Amiibo deals at Best Buy There are dozens of Switch and Siwtch 2 games in Best Buy's sale--however, like many of Best Buy's Black Friday deals, these are limited-time offers and won't be around forever. So to help ensure you don't miss out on the savings, we've rounded up the best Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 game deals from Best Buy's sale into handy lists below. You can also check out the full lineup of discounts at Best Buy's online store, and can find even more holiday price cuts at GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub. Black Friday Switch 2 Games Deals at Best Buy While you won't find deals on first-party Nintendo games in Best Buy's sale (because, let's be honest--there aren't many Nintendo-published Switch 2 exclusive just yet), there is a solid selection of third-party titles on discount. Some noteworthy considerations are the acclaimed sandbox stealth-action game Hitman: World of Assassination - Signature Edition and Ubisoft's open-world Star Wars adventure Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition. You can also dive into the long-running Like A Dragon series while Yakuza 0 Switch 2 Edition. There are several more Switch 2 game deals in Best Buy's sale, and we've listed some of our favorites below. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fanatical Black Friday Sale - Save On Hundreds Of PC Games
description: Fanatical's Black Friday Sale is now live, offering steep discounts on hundreds of PC games. This gives you a chance to win anything from discount coupons to games (and all purchases also come with a guaranteed 5% off voucher for your next purchase). See all deals at Fanatical As for the game deals, you'll find several AAA RPGs in the event, such as The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Anniversary Edition for $14.49 (was $50), The Elder Scrolls Online for $4.39 (was $20), and Fallout 76 for $8.79 (was $40). You can also grab the massive Warhammer 40,000 RPG, Rogue Trader: Voidfarer Edition, for just $35 (was $100). Both Monster Hunter Wilds and Monster Hunter Rise + Sunbreak are down to some of their best prices of the year. Wilds is just $41.29 (was $70) which is a great price for the newest entry in the series that launched earlier this year, while the Rise + Sunbreak bundle is just $8.39 (was $60), and is a solid pick for anyone who hasn't experienced it yet. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: NBA Jam's Iconic Announcer Barely Made Any Money From It
description: If you grew up during the '90s and played NBA Jam, then you know the voice of Tim Kitzrow. His memorable commentary on the game became part of NBA Jam's blockbuster success in arcades. However, Kitzrow has revealed that he was paid a very small amount for his work in the first game. While speaking with The Escapist, Kitzrow disclosed that he was paid $50 an hour for his work on NBA Jam, which was the same amount of money he made recording lines for Bally Midway's pinball machines. It wasn't until after the game was released that Kitzrow realized that he should have charged more. "I'd go in, do a couple of sessions, maybe 15 hours total, and that was it," recalled Kitzrow. "I wasn't smart enough, savvy enough to know the business, to go, 'Gee, these games make a lot of money, maybe I should make more than $50 an hour.' I didn't have an agent at the time ... When the game came out and I found out it made a billion dollars, that's when I realized I'd made like $800 and change ... I thought, 'Well, I'm probably being underpaid, I might want to raise my rate.'" Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: CoD: Black Ops 7 Update Adds Disconnect Protection For Endgame
description: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 received a small update on November 25, and the patch notes revealed a much-needed fix for the campaign's Endgame mode. The update added a new protection for disconnects that previously caused players to lose all of their progress in the mode. Black Ops 7's Endgame works much like the high-risk/high-reward structure of extraction-style shooters. Players grind matches of Endgame to level up their characters' abilities and combat rating, and failing to successfully extract from the map means they lose everything. Unfortunately, players were losing everything to random disconnects and game crashes as well. Treyarch said it heard the feedback from players, and the new update adds a disconnect protection. Now when players drop into matches of Endgame, the game snapshots the player's Combat Rating at the start of the match. This means players will keep their progress that was snapshotted at the start of the match even if a disconnect or crash occurs. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: TimeSplitters Rewind Is A "Greatest Hits" Remake You Can Play For Free
description: TimeSplitters Rewind, a remake of sorts of the original TimeSplitters trilogy, is now available completely for free on PC and with the official blessing of the IP holder. TimeSplitters, TimeSplitters 2, and TimeSplitters: Future Perfect were a trio of well-liked FPS titles created in the early 2000s by UK developer Free Radical. The developer was working on TimeSplitters 4 when it went bankrupt in 2008 and was later absorbed by Crysis developer Crytek. A few years later in 2013, Crytek gave its official blessing to a TimeSplitters fan project looking to keep the franchise alive, even going so far as to provide original TimeSplitters assets for the project. The IP would later be transferred to THQ Nordic (now part of the Embracer Group), which honored Crytek's original agreement for the fan project, even as it briefly resurrected Free Radical with the intent on bringing the TimeSplitters franchise back to life. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Expedition 33 Actor Says He's "Truly Grateful" For Outpouring Of Support After Charlie Cox Spoke Out
description: Recently, actor Charlie Cox reacted to his nomination for Best Performance in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 by saying the credit should also be shared with the performance-capture actor, Maxence Cazoria. Now, Cazoria has said he's receiving an outpouring of support after Cox spoke up, saying what Cox said about him was "incredibly generous." "Thank you for all the messages these past few days. Charlie's words were incredibly generous, and I'm truly grateful," Cazoria said. "Bringing Gustave to life was a team effort, and I'm honored to have played my part in it. Thank you all so much for the love and support. Tomorrow comes." Cox said he was "thrilled" to be nominated, adding that Cazoria should get the credit. "I believe the performance of that character is really down to him and my voice was just a part of that process," he said. Continue Reading at GameSpot
